title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 1st ‘Twilight’ rideshare mission
summary: The flight includes 40 deployment events for a variety of payloads, including NASA’s Pandora spacecraft. Liftoff from pad 4E is scheduled for 5:19 a.m. PST (8:19 a.m. EST / 1319 UTC).

title: NASA’s Pandora Satellite, CubeSats to Explore Exoplanets, Beyond
summary: A new NASA spacecraft called Pandora is awaiting launch ahead of its journey to study the atmospheres of exoplanets, or worlds beyond our solar system, and their stars. Along for the ride are two shoebox-sized satellites called BlackCAT (Black Hole Coded Aperture Telescope) and SPARCS (Star-Planet Activity Research CubeSat), as NASA innovates with ambitious science […]

title: Hyperspectral Microwave Sounder Set for Launch Following Final Testing Phase
summary:
Los Angeles CA (SPX) Nov 25, 2025


Spire Global, Inc. has completed environmental testing, calibration, and flight qualification for its Hyperspectral Microwave Sounder (HyMS) payload, which is now integrated into a Spire 16U satellite and shipped to Vandenberg Space Force Base for launch aboard SpaceX's Falcon 9 Twilight mission. 

The HyMS payload will serve as a technology demonstrator, aiming to validate the function of a

title: Next-generation satellites from Spire Global prepared for SpaceX Falcon 9 Twilight mission
summary:
Los Angeles CA (SPX) Nov 19, 2025


Spire Global has shipped nine satellites, designed and built in-house, to Vandenberg Space Force Base in California for an upcoming SpaceX Falcon 9 Twilight mission. This shipment comprises Spire's latest Hyperspectral Microwave Sounder (HyMS) demonstrator - a compact, space-ready sensor developed in collaboration with RAL Space and STAR-Dundee Ltd.
